alert.note: Alert for Cook; DuPage; Lake (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued March 31 at 7:09PM CDT until March 31 at 11:00PM CDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: The National Weather Service in Chicago has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northwestern Cook County in northeastern Illinois... Northern DuPage County in northeastern Illinois... Southeastern Lake IL County in northeastern Illinois... * Until 1100 PM CDT. * At 709 PM CDT, doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms continuing to produce heavy rain across the warned area. Up to 4 inches of rain have fallen with rain rates nearing 2 inches per hour. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. HAZARD...Significant flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Rapid-onset, significant flooding of creeks, streams, drainage ditches, low-lying areas, and poor drainage areas. Widespread street and underpass flooding. Possible flooding of structures. Possible flooding of highways. * Some locations with the highest threat of significant flash flooding include... Des Plaines, Glenview, Morton Grove, Skokie, Wilmette, Winnetka, Evanston FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1-2 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
